name: Fluphenazine (Prolixin)
summary: A high-potency typical antipsychotic used to treat schizophrenia and other chronic psychotic disorders.
description: Fluphenazine is a high-potency typical antipsychotic of the phenothiazine class. It acts primarily as a dopamine D2 receptor antagonist, reducing positive symptoms of psychosis such as hallucinations and delusions. Available in oral, short-acting injectable, and long-acting decanoate forms, it is used for both acute symptom control and long-term maintenance therapy in schizophrenia.

monitoring_required: ECG in patients with cardiac risk

sections.text: Blocks dopamine D2 receptors in the mesolimbic pathway, reducing positive symptoms of psychosis; also blocks alpha-adrenergic and histamine receptors.

sections.geriatric: Start at lower doses and titrate cautiously
sections.hepatic_impairment: Use with caution; dose adjustment may be necessary
sections.renal_impairment: No specific adjustment, but monitor closely

sections.text: Onset: hours to days; Duration: 6–8 hours for oral, 1–3 days for short-acting IM.

sections.black_box: Increased mortality in elderly patients with dementia-related psychosis.
other: High risk for extrapyramidal side effects due to high potency
Monitor for tardive dyskinesia with prolonged use
Avoid abrupt discontinuation to prevent relapse

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh potential risks
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; monitor infant
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity to side effects; lower dosing advised

sections.text: Gradual dose reduction recommended to prevent withdrawal dyskinesia and relapse.

items: May be used orally for stabilization before transitioning to long-acting decanoate form
High-potency nature results in fewer anticholinergic effects but more EPS risk
